resources.string: Article 26: 1) Everyone has the right to education. Free education must be applied, at least at the primary and lower education levels. Primary education is required. Technical and career education must be universal, and graduate education must follow the principle of fairness to anyone who can afford it. 2) Education must aim to help people develop a full personality and promote respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms. Education should promote understanding, altruism and friendship among all ethnic groups, religious and ethnic groups, and promote UN activities for the sake of peacekeeping. . 3) Parents have the priority right to choose the type of education for their children. Article 27: 1) Everyone has the right to freely participate in the cultural life of the community, to enjoy the arts and to share the achievements and benefits of scientific progress. 2) Everyone has the right to be protected with material and spiritual rights derived from scientific, literary and artistic works of which he is the author.
